Мне уже 21 год и в моей жизни постоянно меняются аккаунты стим, но Half-Life на этих аккаунтах всегда покупается чуть ли не самой первой. О чем говорить если халфа это шутан в котором все киберспортсмены учились стрелять, а все скиловые игроки так или иначе просиживали часок другой на пабликах. Half-Life как хорошее вино, с каждым годом всё вкуснее и раскрывается с новыми ароматами... 10/10
Спасибо за аим, кроссфаир сталкуард и бут кэмп

took me 7 hours to beat the game. and i have only beaten it once so i am not the best when it comes to lore and easter eggs.

The graphics are average 2000s graphic, not the best. But where the graphics are lacking the gameplay are stacking. The gameplay in half life is the best experience i have ever had with an game. The story is super good and you can understand everything that is going on. The gun play is good except that it feels impossible to spray with the smg lol. 
Everything about this game is good! And it is not overrated or anything it is actually as good as people say it is.
Personally i think i could replay it 3 more times and try to finish the game as fast as possible and try to find funny glitches/tricks you can do.

So in short: If you like games with a lot of guns and action half life is the game for you. If you like puzzle solving then half life is for you, if you like story rich games then half life is for you.

Ero troppo piccolo per capire l'impatto che doveva aver avuto Half-Life sull'industria videoludica quando è uscito, in particolare sul mondo degli sparatutto in prima persona, che fino ad allora non davano molta importanza alla trama. Ho recuperato il titolo in questione quando ero già adulto, e anche se è un po' invecchiato, rimane comunque un'esperienza piacevole, pur non essendo il tipo di sparatutto che prediligo.

Are you thinking what I'm thinking?

After being introduced to Portal in 2021, I was then encouraged by a coworker to check out the Half Life series. I normally never liked the idea of FPS games - but after a while of playing I became quite addicted to shooting aliens and bad guys. I'll be honest, as a new PC gamer I had not yet ventured into playing with a mouse and keyboard. I had only played with a controller. But because this old game had no controller support, I was forced to try it and became more proficient with it. I now prefer it (of course) over a controller for this genre. It was cool to see the old graphics - from which we started. It kinda reminded me of playing an old DOS game: Corridor 7. It was after this game I was hooked and had to play the other games in the series!

Desde mi punto de vista , este es uno de los mejores videojuegos desarrollados por Valve , sus mecanicas como graficas para su epoca fueron revolucionarias, con mecanica utilizadas hasta hoy en dia , en donde se han logrado mejorar con el pasar de los años.Este videojuego cuenta con una historia atrapadora , entretenida , y ademas tiene contenido expansible con Opposing Force , Blue Shift y Decay, ademas de las secuelas . En conclusion , vale la pena comprar este juego a pesar de su antiguedad .

classic
good

This game has aged remarkably well - a compelling narrative shooter with some genuine thrills and impressive AI to this day - worth a shot.

It hasn’t aged flawlessly though; the quake engine’s physics objectively make the first-person platforming worse and some of the level direction and puzzles can be vague to say the least. And the final act is a real downgrade; feels super rushed and unpolished. Because it is. 

If you’re interested in playing Half-life now? I recommend you Start with Black Mesa and then go on to half-life 2 MMod - the most cohesive and richly nuanced version of this series you can get; but classic vanilla still holds up; a testament to valves design chops. 

7.9/10

A revolutionary game that changed the gaming industry and the FPS genre as a whole forever. You should absolutely buy and play this game if you're into first person shooters.
However, it was my first "boomer shooter" ('90s shooters like Classic Doom, Quake, Duke Nukem 3D), and my first playthrough (circa July 2021) had some problems I accidentally caused myself.
Don't let this happen to you. Here are some tips and stuff that you should know in general:
[list]
    [*] Play in OpenGL if possible. Mixing software mode and widescreen (a requirement if you want to play on a modern 1080p monitor) breaks the game (just trust me, it does) requiring launch arguments to fix.
    [*] I'm not someone  that tries to 1:1 replicate the 1998 experience (I just told you about widescreen, that wasn't in the original, after all), but please turn off the "HD" models. They do not fit in with the game and are a downgrade.
    [*] Planning on buying the expansions (Blue Shift, Opposing Force, Decay) or Half-Life 2 and its Episodes? You should probably play this first. If you're already decided, check how much are the Half-Life 1 Anthology (Half-Life, its expansions except for the PS2 Exclusive "Decay" and Team Fortress Classic), the Half-Life Complete Pack (HL1 Anthology + Half-Life Source, a terrible buggy mess I'll talk about later + Half-Life 2 and its episodes) and the Orange Box (Half-Life 2, its episodes, Portal and the premium version of TF2, which you'll need plus a non-limited Steam account in order to chat in that game). [b] Don't get overwhelmed, though. Start with this one and see if you like it.[/b]
    [*] What about the Half-Life: Source remaster and the Black Mesa remake? Do not, under any circumstance, play Half-Life Source. Half-Life in Valve's former flagship engine sounds like an excellent idea in theory but HLS executes it terribly. It's a broken, buggy mess. You should play the original Half-Life and Half-Life 2 before playing Black Mesa, which is fine.
[/list]
